   Seminar:Ghosts, Gods, Buddhas

This course is a survey of the major historical and contemporary currents of China’s religious thought and practice, including diffused religion, Buddhism, Confucianism, Daoism, Christianity and Islam. It focuses on the role of religion in Chinese society and on the the interactions between teachings and practices.
You will study topics such as divination, visual culture, ritual, ancestor worship, morality, longevity techniques, healing practices and meditation.
A selected number of primary and secondary sources will be discussed in each lecture. Direct immersive experience of Shanghai’s ritual spaces, places and objects  are an unique and key feature of this course.
